page.title: 20TOURISM IN THE ARUNDEL AREA
page.content: Arundel is a key centre for tourism. Hikers and cyclists come throughout the year. Arundel park offers miles of unspoilt trackways, splendid views and quiet for the serious walker, the artist and nature lover. Lower down, around Swanbourne Lake, families picnic and play. The Wild Fowl Trust caters both for families happy to feed grain to strange birds and the ornith- ologist keen to spot a rare migrant from the hides. The Arun attracts water-lovers; power-boats, canoeing, fishing, birdwatching and the artist. Disused chalk-pits attract geologists and fossil hunting. Scouts camp on a private site by the river. Whiteways Picnic Park caters for the motorist en-route. Noisy cars annoy the villagers. This area is for walkers, artists, ornithologists, fishermen and nature lovers.
